            "role": "Developer",

            "description": "The Customer Communication Engine (CCE) was created out of the need to provide customers with a written confirmation for any type of order placed with Bell. These confirmations allow the customer to easily validate that the order that was entered reflects his or her understanding. As of BRS11 (July 2010) CCE is used to confirm the following types of orders: 1) Most Billing changes 2) Most service orders (Bell home phone, Bell TV and Bell Internet), excluding Bell Mobility a) As a result of a customer making an order through a store (retail) b) As a result of a customer placing a call to a call center (non-retail) 3) Bell TV (Multiview) specific service events such as programming changes, receiver activations, etc. Most of these confirmations are sent via email, with the exception orders made in a store (i.e. retail) which are printed in the store and handed to the customer on paper. These orders are routed to the downstream that send those orders to the markets for execution or can be routed to other PTMS systems in other geographies for market routing.
